Feedback on figures, tables, references, and supplementary materials is usually deferred to the end. The second approach is to organize comments by significance, prioritizing major concerns—such as issues with study design or statistical analysis—before moving on to minor suggestions for improvement. In this format, comments on the Results or Discussion section may precede those on the Introduction or Methods section if deemed more important from a review standpoint. Regardless of the structure you choose, several general principles should guide your review (5). First and foremost, communicate clearly.
